conclusion: The pedestrian runs at a constant speed to catch up with a bus stopped by a red light.
The pedestrian is 36 meters away when the light turns green and the bus starts moving with uniform acceleration.
The v-t graph shows the pedestrian's speed is constant at 8 m/s.
The v-t graph shows the bus's speed increases over time.
The pedestrian's distance from the bus decreases initially.
As the bus accelerates, it eventually overtakes the pedestrian.
The pedestrian's speed is not enough to catch up with the bus's increasing speed.
The pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
